meanings.definition: Acting before an anticipated event occurs in order to prevent it.
meanings.sent1: She preemptively packed an umbrella before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: The security guard preemptively stopped the intruder from entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preemptively gathered extra nuts in case of a rainy day.
meanings.sent4: The superhero preemptively thwarted the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent5: The teacher preemptively explained the difficult concept to the students to avoid confusion later.

meanings.definition: Done in order to prevent something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The preemptively installed alarm system kept the house safe.
meanings.sent2: She made a preemptively wise decision to bring an extra battery for her phone.
meanings.sent3: The preemptively prepared picnic basket had all the essentials for a fun day out.
meanings.sent4: The preemptively cancelled flight saved passengers from a stormy journey.
meanings.sent5: The preemptively scheduled meeting ensured everyone was on the same page.
